decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly casting a high number of spells to generate a large amount of mana through rituals and mana-producing cantrips. The goal is to set up a powerful turn where the player can cast multiple copies of Grapeshot to deal lethal damage to the opponent. The deck includes key combo pieces such as Baral, Chief of Compliance and Goblin Electromancer to reduce the cost of spells and increase the efficiency of the combo. The deck also includes disruption in the form of counterspells, allowing the player to protect their combo and disrupt their opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing Eldrazi creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent and disrupt their game plan. It also includes powerful artifacts like Chalice of the Void and Karn, the Great Creator to control the battlefield and shut down opposing strategies. The deck's mana base is designed to efficiently cast Eldrazi creatures and maximize the effectiveness of their abilities. By combining aggressive creatures with disruptive artifacts, this deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain control throughout the game.

The deck focuses on using artifacts to control the opponent's board while generating value through card draw and recursion. It utilizes Urza, Lord High Artificer as the primary win condition, supported by cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The deck aims to maintain board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy through counterspells like Cryptic Command and Metallic Rebuke. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and maximize the effectiveness of cards like Mishra's Bauble and Arcum's Astrolabe.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo pieces, such as Amulet of Vigor, Primeval Titan, and Azusa, Lost but Seeking, to generate massive amounts of mana and quickly ramp into a win condition. By utilizing lands like Simic Growth Chamber and bounce lands, along with cards like Tolaria West and Vesuva, the deck can achieve explosive turns and potentially win the game in just a few turns. The deck focuses on efficient ramp and land manipulation to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with Urza lands and Eldrazi Temple to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher. Chalice of the Void disrupts opponent's strategies, while cards like All Is Dust and Ugin, the Ineffable provide board control. Karn, the Great Creator offers utility and access to sideboard options. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with aggressive Eldrazi creatures and powerful colorless spells to quickly close out games.

This modern red aggro deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with low-cost burn spells and fast creatures. The goal is to deal damage quickly and efficiently, utilizing cards like Lightning Bolt, Lava Dart, and Lava Spike to take down the opponent's life total. Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage provide early aggression, while cards like Runaway Steam-Kin and Bedlam Reveler help refill your hand and keep up the pressure. The deck aims to win the game before the opponent can stabilize or gain control, relying on speed and aggression to secure victory.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly using the Amulet of Vigor and bounce lands like Simic Growth Chamber to play powerful threats like Primeval Titan early in the game. The goal is to abuse the Titan's ability to search for lands and combo pieces, generating massive advantage and overwhelming the opponent with giant threats like Field of the Dead. The deck also includes toolbox cards like Reclamation Sage and Engineered Explosives, providing answers to opponent's threats. With careful management of resources and efficient play, this deck can quickly assemble its combo pieces for a devastating final blow.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Mine) in order to generate a large amount of mana and cast powerful threats such as Wurmcoil Engine, Walking Ballista, Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, and Karn Liberated. The deck also includes various search cards like Expedition Map and Sylvan Scrying to find the tron lands quickly. Additionally, it includes board wipes like Oblivion Stone and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon for control and removal, while utilizing card selection with Once Upon a Time and Ancient Stirrings.

The deck focuses on using Jeskai Ascendancy to generate a powerful engine of card draw, mana ramp, and creature untapping to continuously fuel a combo win condition. By using cards like Manamorphose, Glittering Wish, and Fatestitcher, the deck is able to cycle through its library quickly and find the necessary pieces to win the game. The deck aims to create a fast and resilient combo that overwhelms the opponent before they have a chance to set up their own game plan.

The deck revolves around utilizing lands such as Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Field of the Dead to repeatedly trigger powerful landfall abilities. By ramping quickly with cards like Arboreal Grazer and Sakura-Tribe Elder, and using Primeval Titan to search for key lands, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a flood of landfall triggers and massive creatures. The inclusion of cards like Dryad of the Ilysian Grove and Knight of the Reliquary provide additional utility and synergy with the land-based strategy, allowing for explosive combos and overwhelming board presence.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful Eldrazi creatures and colorless spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. By ramping up mana quickly with Eldrazi Temple and Urza lands, the deck can cast threats like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher early in the game. Chalice of the Void can shut down opponents' low-cost spells, while Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Ineffable provide additional utility and removal. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure to end the game swiftly with large Eldrazi creatures.

The deck revolves around playing aggressively and utilizing Death's Shadow as a powerful threat. The deck is designed to control the board early on with disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, while also filling the graveyard with cards like Street Wraith and Thought Scour to enable powerful plays with Gurmag Angler and Snapcaster Mage. The combination of disruption, efficient creatures, and the ability to quickly close out games with Death's Shadow make this deck a formidable opponent in the Modern format.

This deck utilizes the UrzaTron lands to quickly ramp up mana and cast powerful colorless spells like Wurmcoil Engine, Ulamog, and Karn Liberated to control the game and overwhelm the opponent. It includes various mana-fixing cards like Sylvan Scrying and Chromatic Sphere to ensure consistent land drops and access to the Tron lands. The deck also includes removal options like Oblivion Stone and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to deal with threats and maintain board control. The goal is to establish a dominant board presence and control the game until victory.

The deck relies on playing aggressive Human creatures with disruptive abilities to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards that provide mana acceleration and protection for the creatures, the deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent while also controlling their plays through cards like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter. Key creatures like Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish benefit from each other, growing in power with every new Human creature that enters the battlefield. The strategy is to outpace the opponent and seize victory through early and consistent aggression.

The main strategy of this Aggro Jund deck is to disrupt the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, while generating value through cards like Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger and Bloodbraid Elf. The deck also aims to control the board with removal spells such as Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push, while applying pressure with powerful threats like Tarmogoyf and Raging Ravine. Additionally, the deck utilizes planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Wrenn and Six to generate card advantage and further disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill your graveyard with cards using cards like Shriekhorn and Cathartic Reunion, enabling you to utilize the Dredge mechanic to bring back creatures like Prized Amalgam and Bloodghast from the graveyard. This allows you to create a powerful board presence and potentially deal direct damage with cards like Creeping Chill and Conflagrate. The deck is designed to be fast-paced and overwhelming, aiming to win the game through a combo of graveyard recursion and aggressive creature damage.
